intro: Xyris kundelungensis, commonly known as the Kundelungensis yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Xyridaceae family, which includes various grass-like plants known for their ornamental value. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
